section.name: Astro Runtime
section.p: The Astro Runtime is a facade for any client code that wants to access Virtual Observatory services. It's facilities are exposed via a range of techniques - HTTP / XML-RPC / Java-RMI, making it easily accessible from almost all programming and scripting languages.

The runtime simplifies access to
IVOA standard services : Registries, Siap, SSAP, (SkyNode coming real soon now)
All AstroGrid services : MySpace, Workflow, CEA
Other popular protocols: NVO Cone-search
Useful one-off services - CDS Simbad, etc
It also provides GUI components - simple dialogues that can be reused by client applications to perform common tasks (myspace microbrowser, registry browser, etc). Other benefits of the runtime include single sign-on, single-configuration, and single cache service responses - making implementation of client-side applications simpler.

section.name: Application Downloads
section.p:
As one size rarely fits all, the Astro Runtime is released in four flavours. Each flavour is available in different ways -
as a webstartable application Simple install and update. Recommended for end users (Astronomers) a single executable jar file Configurable. For advanced use, server deployment, or where webstart isn't available a zip of jars and docs For embedding in your own project
